channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: How world's best are spearheading British doubles boom
item.description: Julian Cash and Lloyd Glasspool tell BBC Sport about finishing the year as the world's top-ranked doubles pairing - and why British doubles is in such good shape.

item.title: 'It gives me chills' - Italian 'brotherhood' inspires Davis Cup hat-trick
item.description: Flavio Cobolli and Matteo Berrettini lead Italy to a historic third straight Davis Cup title in Bologna.

item.title: Cobolli wins epic 32-point tie-break to send Italy into final
item.description: Flavio Cobolli says sealing Italy's place in the Davis Cup final was "one of the best days of my life" after he saves seven match points to win a 32-point tie-break against Belgium's Zizou Bergs.

item.title: Body or ranking - Boulter's Australian Open dilemma
item.description: Britain's Katie Boulter says she feels she has to "choose between my body and my ranking" as the scramble continues for a place in January's Australian Open main draw.

item.title: Italy edge closer to Davis Cup three-peat
item.description: Holders Italy overcome Austria to move a step closer to becoming the first nation to win three consecutive Davis Cup titles for 53 years.

item.title: Tennis Australia and playersâ€™ association near deal over lawsuit
item.description: The Professional Tennis Players' Association and Tennis Australia say they are likely to reach a settlement in the "near future" in relation to the lawsuit filed against multiple governing bodies.

item.title: 'Tremendous honour' - Federer added to Hall of Fame
item.description: Roger Federer will become the first member of the 'Big Three' of tennis to be inducted to the International Tennis Hall of Fame next year.

item.title: British Grand Slam winner Salisbury to take a break over anxiety
item.description: Joe Salisbury has experienced the highs of winning Grand Slams and reaching number one in the world. This season he has struggled with anxiety, he tells BBC tennis correspondent Russell Fuller.

item.title: Wimbledon expansion plan to be challenged in court
item.description: Plans were approved for 38 new tennis courts and an 8,000-seat stadium at Wimbledon.

item.title: Why Raducanu v Osaka whets the appetite for 2026
item.description: Grand Slam winners Emma Raducanu and Naomi Osaka are expected to face each other at the United Cup in Perth in their first event of the 2026 season.

item.title: Raducanu pulls out of US exhibitions with foot issue
item.description: Emma Raducanu will focus on a training camp in Spain rather than travel to the United States to play two exhibition matches next month, as she manages a foot issue.

item.title: Defiance, energy, new heights - Sinner keeps Alcaraz 'on a leash'
item.description: After losing two Grand Slam finals and the number one crown to his great rival, Jannik Sinner again shows Carlos Alcaraz how he can bounce back from adversity.

item.title: Patten's partners make it dream week for him at ATP Finals
item.description: Great Britain's Henry Patten completes a life-changing visit to Turin by becoming an ATP Finals champion for the first time - a week after proposing to his girlfriend in the city.

item.title: Sinner and Alcaraz eye 2026 'great battles' as Italian wins ATP Finals title
item.description: Jannik Sinner signs off his 2025 season in style by overcoming world number one Carlos Alcaraz in two tight sets to defend his ATP Finals crown in Turin.

item.title: Hewett loses Masters final to world number one Oda
item.description: Great Britain's Alfie Hewett loses 6-1 6-1 to Japan's world number one Tokito Oda in the men's singles final of the Wheelchair Masters in Huzhou, China.

item.title: Hewett and Reid beaten in quest for record title
item.description: Great Britain's Alfie Hewett and Gordon Reid lose an epic Wheelchair Masters final as they narrowly fail to win a record fourth title.

item.title: Auger-Aliassime beats Zverev to set up Alcaraz semi
item.description: Canada's Felix Auger-Aliassime sets up a semi-final with world number one Carlos Alcaraz by beating Germany's Alexander Zverev in the final group match of the ATP Finals.

item.title: 'It means the world' - Alcaraz secures year-end number one ranking
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz secures the year-end world number one ranking by reaching the knockout stages at the ATP Finals with three straight wins.

item.title: 'Superman' Djokovic had 'slap from reality in last couple of years'
item.description: Novak Djokovic still believes he can win a 25th Grand Slam title - despite being given a "slap from reality in the last couple of years".

item.title: Is WTA Finals bringing change to Saudi Arabia?
item.description: The season-ending WTA Finals has been held for the second time in Saudi Arabia - a controversial move which continues to be scrutinised.

item.title: Alcaraz battles back to beat Fritz in thriller at ATP Finals
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz comes through a thriller against Taylor Fritz and Lorenzo Musetti captivates the home crowd at the ATP Finals in Turin.

item.title: 'Surreal' - GB's Cash & Glasspool secure year-end number one ranking
item.description: Britons Julian Cash and Lloyd Glasspool secure the men's doubles year-end world number one ranking by earning their first victory at the ATP Finals.

item.title: Why Rybakina refused photo with WTA chief Archer
item.description: After claiming the biggest payday in women's tennis history, why did Elena Rybakina refuse a photo with WTA Tour CEO Portia Archer?

item.title: Boulter loses to Pegula as GB out of BJK Cup
item.description: Watch the best shots, as the United States' Jessica Pegula fights back from a set down to beat Katie Boulter and knock Great Britain out of the Billie Jean King Cup at the semi-final stage.

item.title: GB's Kartal runs Navarro close in BJK Cup semi-final
item.description: A battling Sonay Kartal falls to the United States' Emma Navarro, as Great Britain go 1-0 down in the semi-finals of the Billie Jean King Cup.

item.title: Boulter win puts GB into BJK Cup semi-finals
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Katie Boulter's win over Moyuka Uchijima sees Great Britain secure a 2-0 win over Japan, setting up a Billie Jean King Cup semi-final with the United States.

item.title: GB's Kartal dominates Shibahara in BJK Cup match win
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Sonay Kartal beats Ena Shibahara of Japan to give Great Britain a 1-0 lead in their Billie Jean King Cup quarter-final tie.

item.title: Borg will fight cancer 'like it's a Wimbledon final'
item.description: Tennis legend Bjorn Borg says "I hope I'm gonna be OK" after being diagnosed with "extremely aggressive" prostate cancer.

item.title: How will GB cope without Raducanu in BJK Cup?
item.description: Emma Raducanu is missing the Billie Jean King Cup to focus on the WTA Tour.

item.title: Alcaraz overcomes Sinner to win US Open
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz triumphs in the latest chapter of his compelling rivalry with Jannik Sinner, earning a four-set victory to regain the US Open title.

item.title: Valuable lessons and tough losses - world number one Sabalenka's 2025
item.description: How some self-reflection on a mid-season holiday helped Aryna Sabalenka go from near-misses to year-end number one.

item.title: Modified court and one serve each - Sabalenka v Kyrgios divides opinion
item.description: Women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka will face controversial Australian Nick Kyrgios in a Battle of the Sexes-style event.

item.title: 'I'm always looking ahead' - Mboko eyes bright future
item.description: At the start of 2025, Victoria Mboko was ranked outside of the world's top 300. Now the teenager has cracked the top 20 after winning another WTA title.

item.title: How new WTA leader can draw on Dolly Parton & NBA experience
item.description: New WTA chair Valerie Camillo is tasked with driving growth for women's tennis - and can draw on her experience working with country music superstar Dolly Parton.

item.title: Rating Raducanu's season - and what does future hold?
item.description: BBC tennis correspondent Russell Fuller looks at how Emma Raducanu's 2025 season went - and what the future could hold.

item.title: 'Do you want a player to die on court?' - tennis in the heat
item.description: After facing high temperatures on the Asian swing of the tennis tours, some players are questioning the sport's heat policies.

item.title: Electric New York energy reignites etiquette debate
item.description: Is apologising for a net cord courteous or meaningless? BBC Sport looks at why tennis etiquette is back on the agenda at the US Open.

item.title: 'A dream come true' - Alcaraz on winning US Open & reaching world No 1
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz says it's a "dream come true" after winning his second US Open title and regaining the No. 1 spot in the world rankings.

item.title: Sabalenka retains US Open to win first Grand Slam of 2025
item.description: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka beats American Amanda Anisimova 6-3 7-6 (7-3) to retain the US Open and win her first Grand Slam of 2025, having already lost the Australian and French Open finals earlier this year.

item.title: 'Why would you say that?' - Swiatek unimpressed by reporter's question
item.description: World number two Iga Swiatek challenges a journalist after her US Open defeat against Amanda Anisimova, rejecting the suggestion that she needs a "mental break" after the straight sets loss at Flushing Meadows.

item.title: Anisimova gains revenge on Swiatek for Wimbledon final
item.description: Amanda Anisimova knocks Iga Swiatek out of the US Open, to gain revenge for her 6-0 6-0 defeat in the 2025 Wimbledon final.

item.title: Alcaraz 'owns' new haircut - Raducanu
item.description: Speaking at the US Open, after her second round win, Emma Raducanu said Carlos Alcaraz "owns" his new haircut.

item.title: Raducanu beats Tjen to reach US Open third round
item.description: Britain's former US Open champion Emma Raducanu reaches the third round of this year's tournament with a dominant 6-2 6-1 win against Indonesia's Janice Tjen.

item.title: Williams grateful for US Open chance after health issues
item.description: Venus Williams says it is nice to have had the chance to "play more healthy" after serious health issues despite losing in the first round of the US Open.

item.title: Medvedev smashes racquet after losing chaotic thriller
item.description: Watch the moment Daniil Mededev smashes up his racquet after his first-round defeat by Benjamin Bonzi at the US Open.

item.title: I was upset with decision, not photographer - Medvedev
item.description: Daniil Medvedev says his US Open meltdown was a reaction to the umpire's decision after a photographer walked on to court as he was facing match point.

item.title: Raducanu earns first win at US Open since 2021 title
item.description: Watch mini highlights as British number one, Emma Raducanu beats Japanese qualifier Ena Shibahara 6-1 6-2 to get her first US Open win since 2021.

item.title: Who has won tennis' 'Battle of the Sexes'?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team details the history of 'Battle of the Sexes' matches in tennis

item.title: What is US Open prize money?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how much prize money is on offer at the US Open.

item.title: Why is there a pineapple on Wimbledon's men's trophy?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why there is a pineapple on the top of the Wimbledon trophy for the winner of the men's singles.

item.title: Why were there no line judges at Wimbledon 2025?
item.description: Wimbledon are relying on electronic line calling to judge whether a ball is in or out.
